description: Conversion of single dwelling house into three self-contained units (2x2 bed and 1x1 bed maisonette) including part single, part two storey rear extension, two storey side extensions and alterations to openings with associated access and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:   SHM2PGF05, SHM3PCDNE05, SHM4PABWS05.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building and shown on the approved drawings and as described on the planning application form, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and 7.4 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, the existing vehicular crossover shall be stopped up and the area to the front of the crossover reinstated as a public footway.  Reason: To ensure that the development harmonise with the surroundings and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and 6.13, 7.4 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, or any amending Order, no balustrades or other means of enclosure shall be erected on the roof of the extension(s). No roof of any part of the extension(s) shall be used for any recreational purpose and access shall only be for the purposes of the maintenance of the property or means of emergency escape. Reason: To safeguard the privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties having regard to policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and 7.4 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | The rear window on bedroom 2 of the upper floor flat 2 shall be inward opening only and be served with a juliette balcony treatment on the external rear wall and shal not be used as any form of externsl balcony. Reason: To safeguard the privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties having regard to policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and 7.4 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | The residential units hereby approved shall not be occupied until details of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to be provided within the development, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied.  Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Boroughs waste reduction targets having regard for 3.5 and 5.16 and 7a, 3.5 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | Prior to occupation of the residential units hereby approved the works to the rear garden area as outlined on the drawing SHM1xpb4 shall be carried out. These works shall include the implementation of a safe and secure boundary fence at least 1.8 metres high around the external rear boundary of the site but also as the boundary treatment to provide the division between the garden areas serving both residential units.  Reason: In order to provide a satisfactory appearance to the rear of the site and also to provide an acceptable degree of garden space and privacy within the development having regard to relevant policies 7.4 and 7b of Ealing Development Management DPD and 3.5 and 7.4 of the London Plan, policies in the adopted Core Strategy 2012 and all other relevant material considerations. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the 1 bed maisonette to the side and first floor 2 bed flat shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with London Plan 2011 policy 6.13. of the Ealing Development Management DPD.
